fields.description:
We would like to have the ability to share portlets between users. I know it is possible to modify the default dashboard but that limits us to users that have not customized their dashboards. Or maybe even a static/shared portal page configured by the administrator which contains shared items that every user need to see. For us this would be a very useful feature.
Thanks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8759].
  {panel}

Some customers want to _hide_ Jira from their Customers who lodge support requests though email.
They want the Customer not to know about Jira but rather interact purely by email.

The following are some of the problems that the current system has with this:
# When a user sends an email they will recieve an email back saying they have an account at Jira and can then log on.
# They should most probably be put into a special group. (could be specified in the service)
# They can log on to Jira (they should be blocked)  I.e. They should have *Use* permisions but not *Log on* permissions.
# They should receive Notifications without links back to the web pages. (Internal Users should still get the normal ones)
# By default these users will receive Notifications made by themselves.  The default should be set to False.

(That is all I can think of for now.....)
fields.summary: Email only interface to Jira

fields.description:
I need to create a single filter that shows all issues for multiple projects that were reported agaginat (now) Released Versions. This is in order to display a two dimensional portlet showing Projects / Issue types for our execs (who are not Jira experts).
I start with a new search and Version is an available criteria. 
I select one project and select Released Versions form the Version menu. All ok so far.
I then use ctrl key and select an additional project. 
The Version selct menu dissapears from the search panel and when I click Save this search in All Released versions no longer is included in the serach criteria description. I ended up having to create 11 different project specific filters and then set up 1 portlet for each.
Even though different projects have different release version values, would think that the generic "Released Versions" should be useable.
Enhancement? Upcoming fix? Thanks! -- Alix
fields.summary: Cannot create filter for multiple projects all issues in version "Released Versions"

fields.description:
I'd like tags in JIRA, like del.icio.us. I saw Confluence recently added a similar feature.

I realise that bugzilla like keywords could be done with a custom field, however I'm thinking of more specific support. Without suggesting too much of implementation, being able to have multiple tag words on an issue, that are individually recognised and can be enumerated as existing tags in places within the system (during issue creation, for project browsing, or as part of a search).
fields.summary: add support for issue tags

Regarding the default/internal MailListener, the documentation states:

This listener is usually always turned on in JIRA - see Email Notifications for more details. If you want to write more complex or more specific notifications, you can disable the internal MailListener and add your own.

However, as the MailListener is marked as 'internal', it is not possible to be remove it. 

At present, it is necessary to recompile the MailListener class and set isInternal to false.

Need to allow users to delete/remove the MailListener through UI.

fields.description:
Can the Jira default workflow be amended to include more steps and transitions. How do you deactivate the jira default workflow ?

Why am I asking: 
We have many projects set-up on Jira. If any project needs to change we need to deactivate the workflow by selecting workflow scheme = none. 

This will then ask to "associate". It tries to map the steps in the project to the default jira workflow. 
Our projects might have 15 steps. The jira default workflow has 5-6 steps. 
This means we will loose our steps in the project if they are not one of the steps in the jira default workflow. 

Please see attached the Steps we have set-up on one of our projects. 

Regards
Colm
fields.summary: Jira default workflow

fields.description:
Cookies are scoped by host (eg. 'jira.atlassian.com') and path (eg. '/' or '/jira'). JIRA's UI-oriented cookies (set in issue navigator and admin section) are only scoped by host. This causes two problems:

 - All 13+ JIRA cookies are sent to other applications on the same host (Confluence?), quite likely pushing the user's browser over the [20-cookie limit|http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;EN-US;306070] causing odd breakages.
 - You can't have two parallel JIRA servers without their cookie-based preferences interfering.
fields.summary: JIRA cookies aren't scoped by path, so break other webapps on the server

fields.description: I just discovered JIRA's trackback feature today by browsing an external JIRA site and finding an "external references" section that included an excerpt from our internal JIRA and a link to our server, which is inside of our firewall.  Seems like it would be a good idea to disable outgoing trackbacks by default in JIRA, and force the user to manually turn this on.  Might also be nice to include a way to remove those trackback references. :)

fields.description:
If you logon to both system with the same browser and User ID (without selecting "Remember my login on this computer"), session breaks.

How to reproduce:

01. Start Firefox or Opera
02. Open new browser tab
03. Logon to JIRA without clicking "Remember my login on this computer"
04. Open any issue
05.  Open new browser tab
06. Logon to Confluence without clicking " Open new tab in Firefox"
07. Open any space
08. Switch back to JIRA tab and try to open another issue or comment

Result 1: your are logged off - JIRA request re-logon
Result 2: switch to Confluence - Confluence requests re-logon

Any ideas  ?

Known workaround: select "Remember my login on this computer" during logon.
fields.summary: Session breaks using JIRA and Confluence with same browser and User ID

fields.description:
If in the process of development new versions are added to a project, the version pickers
for the jira fields "Affect Versions" and "Fix Versions" are immediately updated.

The version pickers for any custom filed of type version are not!

Jira needs to be stopped and restarted in order to get the custom field version pickers up-to-date.
I tried out all operations possible from the web interface like reindexing and flushing the cache,
but it did not help.
This is a problem because to restart jira you need login access to the server.
In our company, only the separate IT dept. has, so not even I as a web-based jira administrator
can do the update.
Since adding a new release is a very common operation which happens quite often,
asking another department to restart jira is not really a solution!
fields.summary: custom field version picker not up-to-date after adding new versions to project

fields.description:
Previously this parameter was added to overcome the problem with a separator added in as a project. We need to investigate if this is still the case.

-------------- From Email -----------------
This is for anyone having issues importing from Mantis.  I was trying to import several projects using the built in importer but one of my Mantis projects wasn't showing up in the list of projects (my first and most important one).  Looking at the importer code there was a simple query to search for projects but for some reason it explicitly ignored project id #1.  (Perhaps for some historical reason). Anyway, if you are having a problem with your first Mantis project, just change this line in the importer:

  PreparedStatement preparedStatement = connectionBean.getConnection().prepareStatement("select * from mantis_project_table where id <> 1"); 

and remove "where id <> 1".

Rebuild with this updated class and the problem goes away.
fields.summary: Mantis Importer ignores projects with id = 1

fields.description:
Jira should always default to english if an existing locale cannot be found. This will avoid problems like in JRA-8667, where jira is using the Ukrainian locale that is not supported. The 'None' option should also be removed in the Default Locale in General Configurations.

However jira should still default to system when jira is in setup. The only difference is that if no language pack is found then English is chosen instead of 'None'.

fields.description:
The selectbox for Resolution when resoving a bug is invalid.  This is the html it generates:
<select name="resolution" id="resolution">
                    <option value="1"
            selected            >Fixed</option>
            <option value="1"
            selected            >Fixed</option>
            <option value="2"
                        >Won't Fix</option>
            <option value="2"
                        >Won't Fix</option>

            <option value="3"
                        >Duplicate</option>
            <option value="3"
                        >Duplicate</option>
            <option value="4"
                        >Incomplete</option>
            <option value="5"
                        >Cannot Reproduce</option>
    </select>

Here is a rundown of what I experience:
1) Start with Open bug
2) Click "Resolve bug"
3) put in comment if you want, mark it as Fixed
3a) Notice the duplicates of "Fixed", "Duplicate", etc in the resolution list
4) Click Resolve
5) Notice you're at the same page, but with an error message.  Actually, an Error icon with no error message there.  On the left side of the screen the bug shows up as resolved fixed.
6) The bug still shows up in my unresolved list.

The same error occurs if you attempt to go directly from an open bug to a closed and resolved/fixed bug.

If you set it to resolved/fixed, then close it in a separate step, it seems to give errors on the change to resolved/fixed, but no errors when closing.

This points to problems with the processing of that selectbox when there are duplicate entries in it.

How they got there, I haven't a clue.
fields.summary: Duplicate entries in Resolution Pull-down

fields.description:
It seems to me that there are at least 2 different kinds of import/export that would be great to have.  There is the import/export of JIRA enterprise level items.  And then there is the import/export of project data.

In my case, I want to be able to do some prototyping on a new project in a development environment.  When I get it to where I want it, I want to be able to just export that project from the dev region, and then import it into the production region.  The new project of course needs new workflows and other customized items - I realize that this is difficult to do - but it seems like the only alternative I have is that once I am satisfied that the new project is correct, I would have to have the development and production regions up side by side and re-create all of the customizations in the prod region by hand.

I wouldn't want to do my prototyping in the production region for fear of messing up things there or people thinking that the new project was live when it really wasn't.
fields.summary: Project export/import

fields.description:
When creating a new issue, it is not possible to link to existing issues. It has to be done after creating the issue (view the issue and choose the Link operation in the left panel).

To me, it's an unwelcome interruption in the workflow when creating issues. It should be considered to add this feature on the Create Issue page.
fields.summary: Issue linking: Cannot be done when creating
Custom field for One to Many

fields.description:
I have limited what users can see for projects in the dashboard and limited what projects users can enter.  But all of the projects in my installation of JIRA appear in the project dropdown when my users hit Create Issue.  This doesn't make a whole lot of sense to me and is confusing to the users.

If a user can't see it in the dashboard - then they shouldn't see it in the dropdown.

Thanks!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8689].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

It would be nice to be able to turn off the ability to customise dashboards for certain groups and/or different dashboards. That way certain groups could have a default dashboard that can't be edited but in JIRA Enterprise, they could add another dashboard that they could edit but not be able to edit the default dashboard. 

Also, certain groups could edit the default dashboard where as other users could not.
fields.summary: Turn off dashboard customisability for different groups and/or different dashboards
Visual Intercept Importer

fields.description: For users downloading the source code there is no en_UK translations. This means you cannot change the language to english if you have the computer's default language set to a different locale.
fields.summary: Source Distribution does not have translations for 'en_UK'

fields.description:
It should be possible to easily search issues if you know the name of a user but not their user id. This is especially useful since the user picker can be very slow sometimes.

The implementation should have the searcher index the full name with stemming (I think this will allow minor mis-spellings?) and the searcher itself will simply add another option on the select list.

This will of course suffer from the same problems as groups if the user's "Full Name" changes, in that the issues will have been indexed on the old full name. This will require a reindex.
fields.summary: Allow searching of issues by Full Name for all user fields

fields.description: I imported a backup of our production system into a new mssql instance (that's what production runs on too).  My screen tabs other than Fields have been lost.  Help?  Several screens used to have 2 tabs - Fields and SKU.  SKU is now gone.
fields.summary: Imported a 3.2.3 system into a new clean ms sql instance, screen tabs lost

fields.description: If I have checked the Remember me checkbox when logging in, and I have a filter active, and idle for more than 60 minutes (or whatever is defined for my site), when I try to do something with that search (e.g. return to search or next), it has lost that information, even though I am still logged in. The two should go hand in hand - i.e. if login doesn't expire, neither should the search cookie.
fields.summary: Clarify in documentation what "Remember my login on this computer" means; e.g. user stays logged in, but filters timeout when login (session) doesn't
Import into second JIRA instance corrupts first

fields.description: The version picker custom field will display the versions based on one issue from the issues selected during a bulk edit.
fields.summary: Bulk Editing of Version Picker Custom Field should not be permitted when issues from multtiple projects are selected.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8679].
  {panel}

It is sometimes desirable to consider a group of issues together, and be able to see their overall status, eg.:

 - A progress bar indicating overall completedness (like subtasks).
 - Aggregated time tracking info
 - Perhaps some way of bulk changing all grouped issues.

For example, it might be handy to show all issues affecting one customer.  Or our issues might be tracking proposed changes, and we want to group them into a 'change request' to all be done at once.
fields.summary: Managing groups of issues (eg. Change Requests)

fields.description:
JIRA sets cookies to 'remember' the state of some screens, e.g. the state of sections on Issue Navigator and the right-hand menu of the Administration section. There is a limitation of the number of cookies that a web browser will send to a particular server (URL). Hence we need to restrict the amount of cookies set.

There are several options to investigate:
- see if we can unify some cookies into one and encode the information in one cookie
- see if we can restrict a cookies only to certain URLs (all cookies do not need to be sent for each JIRA URL)
- as some cookies are only used by JS and do not need to be sent, we can try restricting a cookie to a URL in JIRA that does not exis, to stop the browser from sending the cookies. In this case need to ensure that JS can still access these cookies.
fields.summary: Jira sets too many cookies

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8671].
  {panel}

I have created a project and assigned a lead. We have created a component within the project. 

Currently when people are logging Jiras they can select either "Unknown" or "my new component". 
I have assigned the "my new component" to myself. 
So if someone selects this component I will get the issue assigned to me. 
I can change all components so that I am the lead. 

BUT 

If someone logging the Jira selects "unknown" the jira is then assigned to the default assignee (which is not me). 
How can I change this so that I get all new jiras directly assigned to me.

Regards
Colm
fields.summary: Modify the "Default Assignee" which is project lead

I would like to ask if there is possible to do the bulk operation for workflow action?
It would be very nice to do it because we have a people that have to work on more then 20 issues and they have to change the state by workflow action on all of these issues. But I did not find how to do it.

Is it possible to do it in the newest verion? Or plan to do it?

Thank you for answer.
Best Regards
Vladimir

fields.description:
If an issue is in a status with no transitions (eg. Closed without a Reopen), then it doesn't have an OSWorkflow 'current step' database record, and the integrity checker complains:

{noformat}
Check workflow current step entries
   ERROR: 	TP-3 - The workflow entry with id 10032 does not have a corresponding current step. 	JRA-4539
{noformat}

This does cause another problem: if you try to switch the project's workflow scheme, the workflow migration breaks with an error:

{noformat}
ERROR

There are errors associated with issues that are to be migrated to the new workflow association.
These errors must be corrected before the workflow association can be completed.
No changes have been made to the database.

Please consult your administrators regarding these errors. Running the integrity checker from the administration section may resolve the problem.

Errors:

    * Unable to determine the current step for issue 'TP-3'.
{noformat}

Allowing the Integrity Checker to 'correct' the situation allows the workflow migrator to complete successfully.
fields.summary: Error setting new workflow scheme when Closed issues can't be reopened

fields.description:
We have JIRA configured process the CVS commit log every 5 minutes.  Each time the commit log is processed the order of the changed files is different in the Version Control tab, even though its the same commit that is being viewed.  Developers find this very annoying especially when numerous files are in a commit and they are going down the list for example to do a code review.  The order keeps changing on them every few minutes thus making it hard to keep track of what they have looked at and what they have not looked at.

See the two attached imaged.  These are subsequent commit long updates of the same CVS commit.

Would it be possible for JIRA to apply some sort order to the list so that it displays consistently from update to update.
fields.summary: Version Control File Order Changes With Each Reprocessing Of The Commit Log

fields.description:
How To Reproduce
1. Click on "Find Issues" in top menu
2. In " Dates and Times" section, set "Created After" to 31/Jan/05 and "Created Before" to 01/Mar/05
3. Conduct search

Result
Jira is searching and showing all issues created from 31-Jan-05 to 28-Feb-05.
The result should only view issues created from 01-Feb-05 to 28-Feb-05.

This is correct for end date but not the start date, current workaround is to read "Created After" as "Created On/After".
Perhaps end date should be changed instead and wording changed to:
"Created On/After"
and
"Created On/Before"
fields.summary: Find Issues: "Created After" searches for "Created On/After" given date

fields.description:
When using double quotes in transition name, we're getting a 502 bad gateaway error resulting in no updating the database.
However the modifications are correctly displayed on the web part interface but not anymore after rebooting the application.
fields.summary: Unable to use double quote in workflow transition name
